Statement-I : When white light is used in YDSE the central bright fringes for different colours are at same position, therefore the central fringes is white.
Statement-II : When white light is used in YDSE, the fringes closest  on either side of the central White fringe is red and the farthest will appear blue.

options.description: Both statement-I and statement-II are correct.

questions.description:
Assertion (A) : If we use two sodium lamps illuminating two pinholes we will not observe any interference fringes.
Reason (R) : The light waves coming out from two independent sources of light will not have any fixed phase relationship and would be incoherent.

options.description: Both A and R are true and R is correct explanation of A.
Both A and R are true but R is not correct explanation of A.
A is true and R is false.
A and R both are false.
